intro: Damaged or stale products must be recorded in SAP to keep inventory accurate. Follow these steps and stage items in the correct area.

reasonCodes.title: Damaged — divert
reasonCodes.desc: Crushed packaging, leaking, broken seal, or otherwise unsellable; divert per store process.

reasonCodes.title: Expired / Stale — discard
reasonCodes.desc: Past best-before or stale. Record as scrap and discard per food safety rules.

steps: Scan the damaged/expired product. On the first scan, choose the correct reason code (DB or SB).
Continue scanning items. Use the same reason code unless it changes.
Review the list and confirm quantities.
Press F12 to post the scrap document.

placement.title: Grocery damages
placement.body: After scanning, place items in the APS section (blue door near the damages area). Use banana boxes from produce for storing damage products.

placement.title: Important
placement.body: Do NOT place frozen or leaking items in the APS area. Follow food-safety and store policy.

candyCredits.title: Candy / Chocolate Credits
candyCredits.intro: For candy/chocolate vendors we do not directly scan out a credit. Use an **Unplanned Cycle Count** to adjust on-hand and then provide the vendor the Cycle Count report.
steps: Use Article Lookup to check current on-hand for the item (call this X).
Physically sort/count expired or damaged pieces you’re claiming (call this Y).
On the Zebra open: 6. Inventory Count → 2. Unplanned Cycle Count (name the count "Credits" if asked).
Scan or enter the UPC/Article for each affected product.
In the EA (each) quantity, enter Z = X − Y (the new on-hand after removing the bad pieces).
Review the lines and post/save the count.

report.title: Give the vendor the report
report.path: Desktop → Store Page → Reports → Operational Reports → Cycle Count
steps: Select the applicable date (today/when you posted the count).
View then print or export the sheet and share it with the vendor.

candyCredits.example: Example: On-hand shows 24 (X). You have 6 expired (Y). In Unplanned Cycle Count, set the EA quantity to 18 (Z) and post. Print the Cycle Count report for the vendor.
